text: "Puss N' Boots/These Boots (Are Made for Walkin')" is a song by Canadian synthpop band Kon Kan, released as the third single from their 1989 album Move to Move. The song peaked at No. 61 in their native Canada, and at No. 58 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100. In October 1989, the song peaked at No. 11 in New Zealand. The song includes samples of Led Zeppelin's "Immigrant Song" and Nancy Sinatra's "These Boots Are Made for Walkin'". The scratch sample that can be heard throughout the song is sampled from Fab Five Freddy's "Change the Beat". ==Charts== {|class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1989) !Peak position |- |Canadian Singles Chart | style="text-align:center;"|61 |- |New Zealand Singles Chart | style="text-align:center;"|11 |- |U.S. Billboard Hot 100 | style="text-align:center;"|58 |} ==References== Category:1989 singles Category:Kon Kan songs Category:1989 songs Category:Atlantic Records singles
title: Puss N' Boots/These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
